name: world_bank_classification
hint_eng: World Bank's country classifications by income level

name: life_expectancy
desc_eng: Life expectancy is a key social development indicator that provides an important summary of mortality conditions within countries. China has made considerable strides in raising the average life expectancy across the country from 69.3 years in 1990 to 76.1 years in 2015. Despite this increase of 6.8 years, life expectancy in China still falls 3.5 years short of the average of 79.6 years found in high-income countries. More

name: gni_per_capita
hint_eng: GNI per capita is the gross national income, converted to U.S. dollars using the World Bank Atlas method, divided by the midyear population.

name: population
hint_eng: All residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.

name: gdp_per_capita_ppp
hint_eng: GDP per capita based on purchasing power parity (PPP) is gross domestic product converted to international dollars using purchasing power parity rates

name: mortality_rate_under_5
desc_eng: Under-five mortality rate measure the number of deaths per 1,000 live births. Since 1990, China has dramatically child mortality, from 53.9 deaths per 1,000 live births to 9.9 in 2016. This rate is still higher than the average for high-income economies of 6.51 deaths, but significantly lower than its neighbors like India (45.2 deaths) and Pakistan (81 deaths).
hint_eng: Under-five mortality rate is the probability per 1,000 that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five

name: urban_population
hint_eng: Urban population refers to people living in urban areas as defined by national statistical offices

name: labor_force_participation
hint_eng: The proportion of the population ages 15 and older that are economically active.

name: internet_penetration
hint_eng: Internet users are individuals who have used the Internet (from any location) in the last 3 months.

name: population_growth
hint_eng: The average annual rate of change of population.

name: energy_per_capita
units_eng: Kg of oil equivalent per capita
hint_eng: Energy use refers to use of primary energy before transformation to other end-use fuels.

name: co2_per_capita
hint_eng: Carbon dioxide emissions are those stemming from the burning of fossil fuels and the manufacture of cement. They include carbon dioxide produced during consumption of solid, liquid, and gas fuels and gas flaring.

name: years_of_schooling
hint_eng: Number of years of schooling that a child of school entrance age can expect to receive.

name: human_development_index
hint_eng: This indicator is a composite statistic that also includes measures of income. For more see: http://hdr.undp.org/en/content/human-development-index-hdi

name: gender_development_index
hint_eng: This indicator is a composite statistic that also includes measures of income. For more see: http://hdr.undp.org/en/content/gender-development-index-gdi

name: gender_inequality_index
hint_eng: This indicator is a comosite statistic designed to measure of gender equality. For more see: http://hdr.undp.org/en/content/gender-inequality-index-gii
